audit_tests.name: 4.1.1 Ensure that the kubelet service file permissions are set to 644 or more restrictive
audit_tests.description: Ensure that the kubelet service file has permissions of 644 or more restrictive.
audit_tests.remediation:
Run the below command (based on the file location on your system) on the each worker node. For example,
chmod 755 /etc/systemd/system/kubelet.service.d/10-kubeadm.conf
audit_tests.default_value: By default, the kubelet service file has permissions of 640.

audit_tests.name: 4.1.2 Ensure that the kubelet service file ownership is set to root:root
audit_tests.description: Ensure that the kubelet service file ownership is set to root:root.
audit_tests.remediation:
Run the below command (based on the file location on your system) on the each worker node. For example,
chown root:root /etc/systemd/system/kubelet.service.d/10-kubeadm.conf
audit_tests.default_value: By default, kubelet service file ownership is set to root:root.

audit_tests.name: 4.1.3 If proxy kubeconfig file exists ensure permissions are set to 644 or more restrictive
audit_tests.description: If kube-proxy is running, and if it is using a file-based kubeconfig file, ensure that the proxy kubeconfig file has permissions of 644 or more restrictive.
audit_tests.remediation:
Remediation:
Run the below command (based on the file location on your system) on the each worker node. For example,
chmod 644 <proxy kubeconfig file>
audit_tests.default_value: By default, proxy file has permissions of 640.

audit_tests.name: 4.1.4 If proxy kubeconfig file exists ensure ownership is set to root:root
audit_tests.description: If kube-proxy is running, ensure that the file ownership of its kubeconfig file is set to root:root.
audit_tests.remediation:
Run the below command (based on the file location on your system) on the each worker node. For example,
chown root:root <proxy kubeconfig file>
audit_tests.default_value: By default, proxy file ownership is set to root:root.

audit_tests.name: 4.1.5 Ensure that the --kubeconfig kubelet.conf file permissions are set to 644 or more restrictive
audit_tests.description: Ensure that the kubelet.conf file has permissions of 644 or more restrictive.
audit_tests.remediation:
Remediation:
Run the below command (based on the file location on your system) on the each worker node. For example,
chmod 644 /etc/kubernetes/kubelet.conf
audit_tests.default_value: By default, kubelet.conf file has permissions of 640.

audit_tests.name: 4.1.6 Ensure that the --kubeconfig kubelet.conf file ownership is set to root:root
audit_tests.description: Ensure that the kubelet.conf file ownership is set to root:root.
audit_tests.remediation:
Run the below command (based on the file location on your system) on the each worker node. For example,
chown root:root /etc/kubernetes/kubelet.conf
audit_tests.default_value: By default, kubelet.conf file ownership is set to root:root.

audit_tests.name: 4.1.7 Ensure that the certificate authorities file permissions are set to 644 or more restrictive
audit_tests.description: Ensure that the certificate authorities file has permissions of 644 or more restrictive.
audit_tests.remediation: Run the following command to modify the file permissions of the --client-ca-file chmod 644 <filename>

audit_tests.name: 4.1.8 Ensure that the client certificate authorities file ownership is set to root:root
audit_tests.description: Ensure that the certificate authorities file ownership is set to root:root.
audit_tests.remediation:
Remediation:
Run the following command to modify the ownership of the --client-ca-file. chown root:root <filename>

audit_tests.name: 4.1.9 Ensure that the kubelet --config configuration file has permissions set to 644 or more restrictive
audit_tests.description: Ensure that if the kubelet refers to a configuration file with the --config argument, that file has permissions of 644 or more restrictive.
audit_tests.remediation:
Remediation:
Run the following command (using the config file location identied in the Audit step)
chmod 644 /var/lib/kubelet/config.yaml
audit_tests.default_value: By default, the /var/lib/kubelet/config.yaml file as set up by kubeadm has permissions of 644.

audit_tests.name: 4.1.10 Ensure that the kubelet --config configuration file ownership is set to root:root
audit_tests.description: Ensure that if the kubelet refers to a configuration file with the --config argument, that file is owned by root:root.
audit_tests.remediation:
Run the following command (using the config file location identied in the Audit step)
chown root:root /etc/kubernetes/kubelet.conf
audit_tests.default_value: By default, /var/lib/kubelet/config.yaml file as set up by kubeadm is owned by root:root.

audit_tests.name: 4.2.1 Ensure that the --anonymous-auth argument is set to false
audit_tests.description: Disable anonymous requests to the Kubelet server.
audit_tests.remediation:
Run the following command (using the config file location identied in the Audit step)
chown root:root /etc/kubernetes/kubelet.conf
audit_tests.default_value: By default, anonymous access is enabled.

audit_tests.name: 4.2.2 Ensure that the --authorization-mode argument is not set to AlwaysAllow
audit_tests.description: Do not allow all requests. Enable explicit authorization.
audit_tests.remediation:
If using a Kubelet config file, edit the file to set authorization: mode to Webhook.
If using executable arguments, edit the kubelet service file /etc/systemd/system/kubelet.service.d/10-kubeadm.conf on each worker node and set the below parameter in KUBELET_AUTHZ_ARGS variable.
--authorization-mode=Webhook
audit_tests.default_value: By default, --authorization-mode argument is set to AlwaysAllow.

audit_tests.name: 4.2.3 Ensure that the --client-ca-file argument is set as appropriate
audit_tests.remediation:
If using a Kubelet config file, edit the file to set authentication: x509: clientCAFile to the location of the client CA file.
If using command line arguments, edit the kubelet service file /etc/systemd/system/kubelet.service.d/10-kubeadm.conf on each worker node and set the below parameter in KUBELET_AUTHZ_ARGS variable.
--client-ca-file=<path/to/client-ca-file>
audit_tests.impact: You require TLS to be configured on apiserver as well as kubelets.
audit_tests.default_value: By default, --client-ca-file argument is not set.

audit_tests.name: 4.2.4 Verify that the --read-only-port argument is set to 0
audit_tests.remediation:
If using a Kubelet config file, edit the file to set readOnlyPort to 0.
If using command line arguments, edit the kubelet service file /etc/systemd/system/kubelet.service.d/10-kubeadm.conf on each worker node and set the below parameter in KUBELET_SYSTEM_PODS_ARGS variable.
--read-only-port=0
audit_tests.impact: Removal of the read-only port will require that any service which made use of it will need to be re-configured to use the main Kubelet API.
audit_tests.default_value: By default, --read-only-port is set to 10255/TCP. However, if a config file is specified by -- config the default value for readOnlyPort is 0.
